title: Edgeville Dungeon

properties.name: description
properties.value: The Edgeville Dungeon is a dungeon in Edgeville. It contains a large variety of monsters spanning across a wide range of levels. It can be accessed by a trapdoor south of the Edgeville bank, or a locked shed (requiring a Brass key to open) west of the Cooks' Guild.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Edgeville DungeonThe RuneScape Classic Wiki also has an article on: classicrsw:Edgeville Dungeon
Edgeville Dungeon
Released4 January 2001 (Update)
MembersNo (excluding Wilderness area)
Floors1
LocationMisthalin
InhabitantsRats, Spiders, Giants, Humans, Demons, Undead
MusicBarbarianism, Forever, Scape Cave
Map

The Edgeville Dungeon is a dungeon in Edgeville. It contains a large variety of monsters spanning across a wide range of levels. It can be accessed by a trapdoor south of the Edgeville bank, or a locked shed (requiring a Brass key to open) west of the Cooks' Guild.

The southern half of the dungeon is free-to-play, and is a popular location for killing Hill Giants on free-to-play worlds. The northern half is members-only, and is in the Wilderness, so anyone who wishes to explore the deeper parts of this dungeon should watch out for PK'ers and only bring items that they are willing to lose. The Members' area is a popular location for killing Chaos druids.

Vannaka the Slayer master can be found here.

Dwarf Multicannon can be used here.

The Paddewwa Teleport on the Ancient Magicks Spellbook takes you to the first room of the Edgeville Dungeon, this teleport cannot be used in a Portal Nexus.

Contents

  • 1 Entrances
  • 2 Monsters
    • 2.1 Southern
    • 2.2 Northern (Wilderness)
  • 3 Spawns
  • 4 Areas
    • 4.1 Non-Wilderness area
    • 4.2 Wilderness area (members only)
  • 5 Gallery
  • 6 Trivia

Entrances[edit | edit source]

There are two entrances to the dungeon. The most common is found in a locked shed north-west of the Cooks' Guild near Varrock on the east side of the River Lum. To get in, the player must bring a brass key, which can be found in the dungeon.

The other entrance is in Edgeville, in the ruined house south of the bank via a trapdoor by a coffin. The entrance is marked by a dungeon icon () on the minimap.

The dungeon trapdoor is south of the bank.
The location of the locked shed.

Monsters[edit | edit source]

Southern[edit | edit source]

  • Rats (level 1)
  • Giant rats (level 3 & 6)
  • Giant spiders (level 2)
  • Zombies (level 18 & 24)
  • Skeletons (level 21, 22 & 25)
  • Hobgoblins (level 28 & 42)
  • Hill Giants (level 28)

Northern (Wilderness)[edit | edit source]

  • Thugs (level 10)
  • Chaos druids (level 13)
  • Deadly red spiders (level 34)
  • Skeletons (level 45)
  • Earth warriors (level 51)
  • Poison spiders (level 64)
  • Chronozon (level 170)
  • Black demons (level 172)

Spawns[edit | edit source]

  • Numerous small piles of coins here and there
  • Bones
  • Bronze arrows (1 & 3)
  • Brass key
  • Brass necklace
  • Red spiders' eggs

Areas[edit | edit source]

Non-Wilderness area[edit | edit source]

  • There is a Mining spot inside the dungeon with 2 copper, 2 tin, 3 iron, 3 silver, 6 coal, 1 mithril, and 2 adamantite rocks. It is almost never used due to the large amount of monsters in the area, coupled with its distance from a bank.
  • Quite a few Hill Giants live in the southern-most area of the dungeon. They are a popular place to collect big bones, particularly on free worlds, since those with a brass key can use the short cut which is near the Varrock west bank.
    • In addition, a locked gate at the end of the hill giant area leads to the lair of the hill giant boss Obor. The gate requires a giant key, dropped from hill giants, to access. Obor and Bryophyta are currently the only free-to-play bosses in Old School RuneScape.
  • Members with 51 Agility can squeeze through a pipe on the east side of the dungeon that leads right to the Moss giants in the Varrock Sewers. It can be used in either direction.

Wilderness area (members only)[edit | edit source]

  • There are several Chaos druids in the Wilderness section, well known for their high drop rate for herbs.
  • There are quite a few red spider eggs respawns in this dungeon, making it easier to collect them for potions.
  • Several Black demons live farther inside the dungeon.
  • There is a demon who resides in the dungeon named Chronozon. He must be killed during the Family Crest quest.
  • There are several level 64 Poison spiders in Chronozon's lair, so an Antipoison would be helpful.
  • The Obelisk of Earth is in the dungeon near Chronozon. The Obelisk of Air can be accessed through the dungeon as well, past the Black demons.
  • The dungeon is currently the only location to house Earth warriors, which are often assigned by Vannaka as Slayer tasks. Players must have 15 Agility to get to them.
  • The Edgeville dungeon monkeybars are approximately equivalent to the Varrock Rooftop course at ~13k xp/hr. You cannot fail the shortcut and it only requires 15 Agility.

Gallery[edit | edit source]

  • An annotated map of the Edgeville dungeon. (click to enlarge)

  • Entrance to the Edgeville dungeon without the brass key.

Trivia[edit | edit source]

  • Several inaccessible fishing spots can be seen in the body of water next to the Chaos druids.

The '''Edgeville Dungeon''' is a [[dungeons|dungeon]] in [[Edgeville]]. It contains a large variety of [[monster]]s spanning across a wide range of levels. It can be accessed by a trapdoor south of the Edgeville bank, or a locked shed (requiring a [[Brass key]] to open) west of the [[Cooks' Guild]].

The southern half of the dungeon is [[free-to-play]], and is a popular location for killing [[Hill Giant]]s on free-to-play worlds. The northern half is [[members]]-only, and is in the [[Wilderness]], so anyone who wishes to explore the deeper parts of this dungeon should watch out for [[Player killing|PK'ers]] and only bring items that they are willing to lose. The Members' area is a popular location for killing [[Chaos druid]]s.

[[Vannaka]] the [[Slayer master]] can be found here.

[[Dwarf multicannon|Dwarf Multicannon]] can be used here.

The [[Paddewwa Teleport]] on the [[Ancient Magicks]] Spellbook takes you to the first room of the Edgeville Dungeon, this teleport cannot be used in a [[Portal nexus|Portal Nexus]].

==Entrances==
There are two entrances to the dungeon. The most common is found in a locked shed north-west of the [[Cooks' Guild]] near [[Varrock]] on the east side of the [[River Lum]]. To get in, the player must bring a [[brass key]], which can be found in the dungeon.

The other entrance is in [[Edgeville]], in the ruined house south of the [[bank]] via a trapdoor by a coffin. The entrance is marked by a dungeon icon ([[File:Dungeon_map_link_icon.png]]) on the minimap.{{Multimap
|map1={{Map|3095,3487|caption=The dungeon trapdoor is south of the bank.}}
|map2={{Map|3113,3454|3113,3450|3118,3450|3118,3454|mtype=polygon|caption=The location of the locked shed.}}
}}
==Monsters==
===Southern===
*[[Rat]]s (level 1)
*[[Giant rat]]s (level 3 & 6)
*[[Giant spider]]s (level 2)
*[[Zombie (common)|Zombie]]s (level 18 & 24)
*[[Skeleton]]s (level 21, 22 & 25)
*[[Hobgoblin]]s (level 28 & 42)
*[[Hill Giant]]s (level 28)

===Northern (Wilderness)===
*[[Thug]]s (level 10)
*[[Chaos druid]]s (level 13)
*[[Deadly red spider]]s (level 34)
*[[Skeleton]]s (level 45)
*[[Earth warrior]]s (level 51)
*[[Poison spider]]s (level 64)
*[[Chronozon]] (level 170)
*[[Black demon]]s (level 172)

==Spawns==
*Numerous small piles of [[coins]] here and there
*[[Bones]]
*[[Bronze arrow]]s (1 & 3)
*[[Brass key]]
*[[Brass necklace]]
*[[Red spiders' eggs]]

==Areas==
===Non-Wilderness area===
*There is a [[Mining]] spot inside the dungeon with 2 [[Copper rock|copper]], 2 [[Tin rock|tin]], 3 [[Iron rock|iron]], 3 [[Silver rock|silver]], 6 [[Coal rock|coal]], 1 [[Mithril rock|mithril]], and 2 [[adamantite rock]]s. It is almost never used due to the large amount of monsters in the area, coupled with its distance from a [[bank]].
*Quite a few [[Hill Giant]]s live in the southern-most area of the dungeon. They are a popular place to collect [[big bones]], particularly on free worlds, since those with a [[brass key]] can use the short cut which is near the [[Varrock]] west [[bank]].
**In addition, a locked gate at the end of the hill giant area leads to the lair of the hill giant boss [[Obor]]. The gate requires a [[giant key]], dropped from hill giants, to access. Obor and Bryophyta are currently the only free-to-play bosses in ''[[Old School RuneScape]]''.
*Members with 51 [[Agility]] can squeeze through a pipe on the east side of the dungeon that leads right to the [[Moss giant]]s in the [[Varrock Sewers]]. It can be used in either direction.

===Wilderness area (members only)===
*There are several [[Chaos druid]]s in the [[Wilderness]] section, well known for their high drop rate for [[herb]]s.
*There are quite a few [[Red spiders' eggs|red spider egg]]s [[Spawning|respawns]] in this dungeon, making it easier to collect them for [[potions]].
*Several [[Black demon]]s live farther inside the dungeon.
*There is a demon who resides in the dungeon named [[Chronozon]]. He must be killed during the [[Family Crest]] quest.
*There are several level 64 [[Poison spider]]s in Chronozon's lair, so an [[Antipoison]] would be helpful.
*The [[Obelisk of Earth]] is in the dungeon near Chronozon. The [[Obelisk of Air]] can be accessed through the dungeon as well, past the Black demons.
*The dungeon is currently the only location to house [[Earth warrior]]s, which are often assigned by [[Vannaka]] as [[Slayer task]]s. Players must have 15 [[Agility]] to get to them.
*The Edgeville dungeon monkeybars are approximately equivalent to the Varrock Rooftop course at ~13k xp/hr. You cannot fail the shortcut and it only requires 15 Agility.

Edgeville Dungeon map.png|An annotated map of the Edgeville dungeon. <small>(click to enlarge)</small>
Edgeville dungeon alternative entrance location.png|Entrance to the Edgeville dungeon without the brass key.
</gallery>

==Trivia==
*Several inaccessible [[fishing spot]]s can be seen in the body of water next to the Chaos druids.
